title: Nheer
author: Nheer
content: I've been following a few gambling channels on Twitter and Telegram, and whenever they share a screenshot of a bet slip or winning ticket, they occasionally also include the balance of their wallet. I've seen this happen several times, which made me wonder why they don't choose to withdraw their winnings instead of storing them in their gambling site wallet. Why do they leave that much in there, or is it simply for show off? A gambling expert should know better than to save their money on casino websites.  I always withdraw all my winnings and only deposit the right amount i want to use to gamble whenever i want to play a game. I’d like to know everyone’s opinion on which way is better and which one do you practice in managing your funds on gambling sites.

A gambling expert should know better than to save their money on casino websites.  I will say it is just for showoff.Quote from: Nheer on September 16, 2023, 02:01:47 PMI always withdraw all my winnings and only deposit the right amount i want to use to gamble whenever i want to play a game. I’d like to know everyone’s opinion on which way is better and which one do you practice in managing your funds on gambling sites. This is the best thing to do. It is not good to leave coins on a gambling site because they are centralized gambling sites. If you need to deposit more coins, it is not hard to do at all.The gambling sites are just like centralized exchanges, you have no full control over your coins and any site can be hacked at anytime.But people will be people, once they do not have a problem on a site, they will become lazy and leaving their coins on the site.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: You are correct about the show-off part, first off since they are advertising their channels they don’t want anyone to think that they are scammers or just want to lure you in so that they can make money off you through their vip subscription so they’ll show to the public that they have more than enough in their account. And as for the savings, I usually don’t keep much in my account. I’m of the opinion that if I keep all the money that I have won in my account sooner or later I’ll use all of them to place a best most especially when I experience some losing streaks, that urge to just keep betting until I win something tangible might take over and I’ll end up with nothing so as don as I have something that I think it’s worth keeping I’ll withdraw and keep playing with what’s left in my account and when that one gets finished I’ll call it a day for that day. After all my gambling account is not meant to save my money so why should I keep more than I can afford to lose in it?

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Crypto users always withdraw their coins from the casinos and only leave a few they are willing to lose.  With users who show off their balance with huge amounts, I guess they are comfortable storing their money in the casino. And most probably that huge amount is nothing to them which they also can afford to lose. As for me, the only funds I can leave are less than $300. Anything more than that, I send it out. Turn it into BTC if I don't plan to spend it.

comments.author: madnessteat
comments.body: Quote from: Nheer on September 16, 2023, 02:01:47 PM~snip~Do you still believe screenshots on the internet? Such screenshots are made in a matter of minutes. For those who are used to working with cryptocurrencies, it's high time to switch to a fairer trust format - signing the message with an address. If I were you, I wouldn't trust strangers from X or Telegram, because there is a possibility that their goal is to run a script on your computer that steals passwords, seed phrases and other information stored on your computer without proper attention.
